    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void coarsen()
      coarsen() performs the following loop until the number of unmatched nodes is less than a ratio of the orinigal nodes: we visit an unvisited node randomly; we match it with the neighbor that yields the maximum value of arcs connecting weight * lamda + (1-lamda)*sum_of_weights_of_arcs_conn_common_nbors we mark as visited both nodes that were matched of course
      private Node getBestNbor(java.lang.Integer pos)
      find the best neighbor that should be matched with the node at position pos.

      • coarsen

        public void coarsen()
             throws GraphException,
                    CoarsenerException,
                    ParallelException
        coarsen() performs the following loop until the number of unmatched nodes is less than a ratio of the orinigal nodes: we visit an unvisited node randomly; we match it with the neighbor that yields the maximum value of arcs connecting weight * lamda + (1-lamda)*sum_of_weights_of_arcs_conn_common_nbors we mark as visited both nodes that were matched of course
        Specified by:
        coarsen in class Coarsener
        Throws:
        GraphException
        CoarsenerException - if coarsening couldn't proceed satisfactorily
        ParallelException

      • getBestNbor

        private Node getBestNbor(java.lang.Integer pos)
        find the best neighbor that should be matched with the node at position pos. The best neighbor is the one maximizing the value lamda*conn_arcs_weight + (1-lamda)*conn_nbors_weight where the second term takes into account the common nbors of the two neighboring nodes, and sums the weights along their connecting arcs. (second order effect)
        Parameters:
        pos - Integer
        Returns:
        Node

        public java.lang.String toString()
